column4: for DSL2 you need your own hardware or a ISP that has that sort of hardware in your Area :)
i didnt even need to setup an account
and your connection will run the second you plug the ehternet in
so if one doesnt work for you then you do have another option to try :)
it depends on what his(her?) service provider provides.
most ISP's support everything unless your going for a smaller ISP
win32codecs? you'll need them to run .asf I think
it's actually very easy to manually edit your own menu file
i set it up on my machine. what do you need to know?
you have to manually edit the menu or (haven't tried it) get download the menu editor
there should be example menu files in /usr/share/fluxbox/ or somewhere like that
package fluxconf comes with a menu editor, but i haven't tried it so...
